Events: The War of the Spanish Succession
People: Phillip V of Spain, Louis XIV of France, Austrian Habsburgs
Causes: Louis XIVâ€™s ambitions for his grandson, Phillip V, to succeed to the Spanish throne
Consequences: Louis XIV gains the Spanish Netherlands and part of Italy; Austria gains the Spanish Habsburg lands and control of the Spanish throne; England gains Gibraltar and Minorca
Opposing Sides: France and allied European powers vs. England and allied European powers
Outcomes: The Treaty of Utrecht gave the Spanish throne to Phillip V and European territories to Austria
Significance: Expansion of French power and Austria gaining territories, setting up the balance of power system for much of the 18th century
